before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"8f9nk","text":"Prepare and store enzymes according to the manufacturer's instructions. Thaw enzymes just before use","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dd5ce","text":"If Buffer ATL contains precipitates, dissolve by heating to   with gentle agitation","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bkiog","text":"Prepare liquid stocks (m[g] = Mr * c[mol/L] * V[L] ) and fill up with nuclease-free water to desired volume","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":23,"length":27},{"style":"sub","offset":31,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7cm5","text":"For long-read sequencing (fragments \u003e 1 kbp) prepare PEG-NaCl-Buffer: ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qb0m","text":"        0.75 M NaCl ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f27lj","text":"        20% PEG: V% = (v/v)% = volume of solute / volume of solution * 100","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E8BA6C2FE42911EDBDEF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"70","unit":10}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8n7rm","text":"Presented method allows the extraction of high molecular weight (HMW) DNA of all lichen symbionts using low input (5 - 100 mg) lichen material. Extractions using fresh and over 50-year-old herbarium material have been successful, yielding HMW DNA fragments from 50 to 200 kbp in length suitable for both short- and long-read sequencing. The protocol includes an initial acetone cleaning step to dissolve secondary lichen metabolites, which can later be identified using thin-layer chromatography (TLC). Apart from an overnight incubation during the enzymatic digestion of fungal, algal, and bacterial cells, this protocol provides a relatively fast and easy extraction method. A final size selection is achieved using Solid Phase Reversible Immobilization (SPRI) magnetic beads and a 20%-PEG-0.75M-NaCl buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"cjnuc","text":"Handle samples very gently. Avoid vortexing, instead gently flick the tubes. Use wide-pored pipettes, which can be made by carefully cutting off the tip of a pipette with a sterile razor blade in a clean bench. During extraction, the number of tubes will double. In the last step, they will be combined again. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2n7nc","text":"For long-read sequencing of HMW DNA use fresh lichen material. To test HMW DNA quantity and quality, capillary electrophoresis is recommended. For short-read sequencing, a quantification using a fluorometer (and gel electrophoresis) is recommended. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ksv0","text":"DNA purity can be examined using a UV-VIS spectrophotometer - an absorbance ratio of A260/A280 in the range of 1.8 – 2.0 and A260/A230 higher than 2.0 indicates good quality and purity of the DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: HMW extraction,lichen,long reads,short reads,SPRI beads extraction,low input,fungal DNA,lichen DNA,DNA extraction,PEG NaCl,enzymatic digestion,symbiont DNA,bacterial DNA,algae DNA,lichen fungi

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4d0jf","text":"Add 1 mL Buffer 1 to each sample ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"607k4","text":"Mix thoroughly by flipping the tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjptl","text":"Incubate for 15 minutes at RT","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rhrf","text":"Centrifuge at   for 2 minutes. If necessary repeat at a higher speed (e.g. for crust lichens) until a precipitate forms","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8n0jr","text":"Discard supernatant","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ll4o","text":"Add 500 µL Buffer 2 to each sample ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d78cd","text":"Mix enzymes well before taking an aliquot. Then add 5 µL each of Glucuronidase, Cellulase, Protoplast F, and Lysozyme to each sample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":80,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":91,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":109,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c35id","text":"Add 90 µL Chitinase to each sample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dd6c4","text":"Place the tubes in a thermomixer overnight at   and rotate at   for 9 seconds every 5 minutes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":46,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"3000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"45835BF0CEE611EDAC8EF37333187DDA","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"73C24520E40E11ED975ED5AEF96D8D23","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"35","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8D80ECB0CEE611EDA6601FF4B67CB55E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"750","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ava45","text":"Set thermomixer to  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ibo5","text":"Centrifuge samples with   for 2 minutes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":24,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"27k1k","text":"Discard supernatant while working under the fume hood","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u3vq","text":"Add 600 µL Buffer ATL and mix slowly and carefully","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vmn7","text":"Add 20 µL Proteinase K and mix slowly and carefully","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9g4ub","text":"Incubate in a thermomixer at   with shaking at   for at least 1 hour","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":29,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e8ieq","text":"Remove samples and set the thermomixer to   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":42,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2vbvn","text":"Briefly centrifuge tubes to remove drops from inside the lid","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfc5l","text":"Add 600 µL Buffer AL, close the lid, and mix gently using the lab rocker at  , or by light shaking. Sample and Buffer AL have to be thoroughly mixed to yield a homogeneous solution","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":76,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3qrh5","text":"For low-input samples, an optional step is to dissolve 1 µg of carrier RNA in 1 µL of buffer ATL. Then, add 1 µL of the dissolved carrier RNA to each sample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":78,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":86,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":97,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":108,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":120,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55et1","text":"Incubate tubes at   in a thermomixer with shaking at   for 10 minutes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":18,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":53,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"buvnl","text":"Briefly centrifuge tubes to remove drops from inside the lid","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ph63","text":"Add 300 µL ethanol (96-100%), close the lid and mix by light shaking or on the lab rocker at   for at least 10 seconds. Mix samples and ethanol thoroughly to ensure efficient binding","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[{"key":8,"offset":93,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e1nn9","text":"Briefly centrifuge tubes to remove drops from inside the lid","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffcgq","text":"Transfer 700 µL of the supernatant into a labelled 1.5 mL DNA LowBind tube. Transfer the remaining ~800 µL into a second labelled tube, resulting in two storage vessels per sample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":99,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"EF421A00CEE611EDA6601FF4B67CB55E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"56","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"3000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F700FB30CEE611EDA6601FF4B67CB55E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"27E8AA40CEE711EDA6601FF4B67CB55E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"56","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"309C72C0CEE711EDA6601FF4B67CB55E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"600","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"4":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"21738720CEE711EDA6601FF4B67CB55E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"70","unit":10}},"5":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"472E39E0CEF311EDA6601FF4B67CB55E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"5","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"6":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"D6AFB500CEE711EDA6601FF4B67CB55E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"70","unit":10}},"7":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"600","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A8FBC340CEF311EDA6601FF4B67CB55E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"8":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"5","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E5F225A0CEF311EDA6601FF4B67CB55E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d41pg","text":"Thoroughly shake the SPRIselect bottle to resuspend the SPRI beads","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":21,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sqvf","text":"Add *1.2 SPRIselect to the sample (sample volume [µL] * 1.2 = SPRIselect [µL]) ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6jbjv","text":"For long-read sequencing, an optional step is to add *0.65 of PEG-NaCl-Buffer (sample volume [µL] * 0.65 = PEG-NaCl-Buffer [µL])","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":62,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4to4","text":"Mix samples gently using the lab rocker, or rock the storage vessels from side to side and incubate at RT for 30 seconds. Mix well, as insufficient mixing will lead to inconsistent results.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rue","text":"Repeat the mixing and incubating step","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f02bu","text":"Place tubes into the magnetic stand and allow the SPRI beads to settle to the magnets (settle times will vary)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dds5","text":"Remove the clear supernatant. Be aware that significant bead loss will result in reduced yield","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5r54","text":"Add 700 µL 5 M NaCl without removing the tubes from the magnetic stand, incubate for 1 minute, and discard the supernatant ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q3jt","text":"Repeat the previous washing step","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2k20p","text":"Remove the tubes from the magnetic stand and add ≥ 20-70 µL of nuclease-free water (or standard buffer like Tris or TE)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":49,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajj4b","text":"Carefully resuspend the beads by slowly mixing them on the lab rocker or by pipetting ten times using wide-pore pipettes until homogeneous","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ivis","text":"Incubate at RT for 1 minute","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ruvr","text":"Place the tubes on a magnetic stand, allowing the SPRI beads to settle to the magnets. If the elution volume is too low so that beads cannot settle to the magnet, flip the magnetic stand while holding the reaction vessels in place","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akur6","text":"Transfer the eluate (HMW DNA) into a labelled 1.5 ml DNA LowBind storage vessel, and combine divided samples","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pnsm","text":"Check DNA quantity and fragment size. If DNA fragments are too short, repeat the size selection part using *0.8 SPRIselect and *1.0 PEG-NaCl-Buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":107,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":128,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"837on","text":"Prepare 20%-PEG-0.75-M-NaCl-Buffer:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85um5","text":"NaCl 58,44 g/mol:  m = M * c * V ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tb0o","text":"PEG 20%:  V% = (v/v)% = volume of solute/volume of solution * 100 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"421ak","text":"20 % = 20 mL/100 mL = x mL / 200 mL * 100 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cueib","text":"x = 20 mL * 200 mL / 100 mL = 40 mL PEG in 200 mL  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dllc","text":"Shake vigorously, vortex and shake again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8069b","text":"Buffer 1: prepare 1 mL/sample (plus overhang) using liquid stocks","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4p9t7","text":"100 mM Tris-HCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ocst","text":"Add 10 mM DTT solution just before use","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crv6g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vqtd","text":"Buffer 2: prepare 500 µL/sample (plus overhang) under the fume hood using liquid stocks","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3h1f","text":"1 M Sorbitol ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p5b4","text":"25 mM EDTA ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rqrm","text":"5.9 mM Citric Acid  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cfb2","text":"4.1 mM Sodium Citrate ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4j68c","text":"14 mM ß-Mercaptoethanol","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1mdn","text":"If necessary clean lichen material using nuclease-free water and dry the sample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96r0j","text":"Cut lichen material into small pieces (µm) using a sterile razor blade or scalpel","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ev22g","text":"Transfer samples into 2.0 ml Eppendorf Protein LoBind tubes and store them at  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":78,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9gh5j","text":"Add 400 µL cold acetone (stored at  ), shake gently and remove the supernatant. Supernatant can be stored for use in thin-layer chromatography (TLC)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b2c1e","text":"Repeat until supernatant is clear","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpag7","text":"Put the tubes in a heating block set at   under the fume hood until the samples are dry","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0447D1A0CEED11EDA6601FF4B67CB55E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A64CB2A3E8E811EDBD1E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A64CB324E8E811EDBD1E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}}}}

title: A cost-effective way of extracting high molecular weight (HMW) DNA from low amounts of fresh or herbarium lichen material

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"582kg","text":"ß-Mercaptoethanol is a toxic, corrosive, and environmentally hazardous chemical. When handling it, always wear gloves and work in a fume hood. Pierce the safety seal using a syringe to access the chemical.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":30,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
